diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +0,4 @@become: Boolean that controls if privilege escalation is used or not on Task execution.
become_flags: A string of flag(s) to pass to the privilege escalation program when ``become`` is True.
become_method: Which method of privilege escalation to use. i.e. sudo/su/etc.
become_user: User that you 'become' after using privilege escalation, the remote/login user must have permissions to become this user.

comments.body: User that you 'become' after using privilege escalation on the remote system, the ``remote_user`` user must have permissions to become this user.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +2,6 @@become_flags: A string of flag(s) to pass to the privilege escalation program when ``become`` is True.
become_method: Which method of privilege escalation to use. i.e. sudo/su/etc.
become_user: User that you 'become' after using privilege escalation, the remote/login user must have permissions to become this user.
check_mode: A boolean that controls if a task is executed in 'check' mode
connection: Allows you to change the connection plugin used for tasks to execute on the target.

comments.body:
s/It does not affect connection errors./Connection errors will always cause an error and stop the playbook run for the  machine./


Not sure what the best wording for "stop the playbook run for the  machine", feel free to change
Suggest using 'Boolean that indicates..." rather than "Boolean that controls..."

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +8,12 @@gather_facts: A boolean that controls if the play will automatically run the 'setup' task to gather facts for the hosts.
hosts: A list of groups, hosts or host pattern that translates into a list of hosts that are the play's target.
ignore_errors: Boolean that allows you to ignore task failures and continue with play. It does not affect connection errors.
name: It's a name, works mostly for documentation, in the case of tasks/handlers it can be an identifier.
remote_user: User used to log into the target via the connection plugin. AKA login user.

comments.body: Allows tasks to have a human readable name, which is best practice. The name can be used as an identified when uses with ``--start-at-task` or for `handlers:`.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +9,13 @@hosts: A list of groups, hosts or host pattern that translates into a list of hosts that are the play's target.
ignore_errors: Boolean that allows you to ignore task failures and continue with play. It does not affect connection errors.
name: It's a name, works mostly for documentation, in the case of tasks/handlers it can be an identifier.
remote_user: User used to log into the target via the connection plugin. AKA login user.
no_log: Boolean that controls information disclosure.

comments.body: Also referred to as the "login user".

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +10,14 @@ignore_errors: Boolean that allows you to ignore task failures and continue with play. It does not affect connection errors.
name: It's a name, works mostly for documentation, in the case of tasks/handlers it can be an identifier.
remote_user: User used to log into the target via the connection plugin. AKA login user.
no_log: Boolean that controls information disclosure.
run_once: Boolean that will bypass the host loop, forcing the task to execute on the first host available and will also apply any facts to all active hosts.

comments.body:
s/Boolean that controls/Boolean that indicates...

Example: 
Boolean that indicates whether or not a log is create.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +17,21 @@tags: Tags applied to the task or included tasks, this allows selecting subsets of tasks from the command line.
vars: Dictionary/map of variables
always_run: DEPRECATED, forces a task to run even in check mode, use check_mode directive instead.
delegate_to: Host to execute task instead of the target (inventory_hostname), connection vars from the delegated host will also be used for the task.
delegate_facts: Boolean that allows you to apply facts to delegated host instead of inventory_hostname.
